text: what kind of functions are you missing from JuliaGraphs?

elements.text: what kind of functions are you missing from JuliaGraphs?

text:
Maybe I have not searched hard enough (if so - please let me know), but here is the list that quickly comes to my mind:

General things:
• allowing for multiple edges
• not all algorithms available for unweighted graphs that have natural extensions to weighted graphs are available
Specific things:
• various community detection algorithms (e.g. Louvain is missing AFAICT)
• vertex embedding algorithms
• graph embedding algorithms
• more extensive coverage for assortativity analysis
The point is that even if some of these things might not fall naturally into LightGraphs.jl scope (e.g. vertex or graph embeddings) they are missing in the ecosystem, which means that one needs to switch to Python anyway as many are available there either in igraph or other Python packages.
